headline.main: The Strange Double Life of Chenin Blanc

lead_paragraph: THE Rodney Dangerfield of grapes, at least in this country, is chenin blanc -- it gets no respect. What's more, its name is redundant; all chenin is blanc. Would anyone ever speak of cabernet sauvignon rouge? Actually, there is a French grape, the pineau d'Aunis, that is sometimes called chenin noir. It is found in the Loire Valley in rose wines.
abstract: Frank J Prial Wine Talk column on chenin blanc grape; photo (M)
